benchmark_details.name: GeoLaux (Geometry Benchmark for Evaluating MLLMsâ€™ Geometry Performance)
benchmark_details.overview: GeoLaux is a benchmark for evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) on long-step geometry problems specifically addressing the auxiliary line construction. It contains 2,186 geometry problems with an average of 6.51 reasoning steps, facilitating fine-grained evaluation of MLLM reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation benchmark for MLLMs in solving long-step geometry problems requiring auxiliary lines.

data.source: Collected from Zhongkao mathematics papers across 34 provincial-level regions in China
data.annotation: Manually curated solutions and reasoning steps with auxiliary line constructions

methodology.calculation: ACS evaluates final answer accuracy, PCS checks correctness of the entire solution process including errors, and PQS assesses the quality of reasoning steps evaluated via a weighted scoring system.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in answering and reasoning accuracy of MLLMs on complex geometry problems.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance results of 13 leading MLLMs were evaluated, with distinct findings based on step lengths and problem types.
methodology.validation: The benchmark's effectiveness was validated through extensive testing across various MLLMs.
